definition: to go out/to leave for another place

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
one depends on one's parents when at home, and on one's friends when away from home (idiom)
pinyin: zai4 jia1 kao4 fu4 mu3 , chu1 wai4 kao4 peng2 you5
containing_words.word: 在家靠父母，出外靠朋友

sentences.english: She dresses up fit to kill even to go out shopping.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至出外購物，也打扮得花枝招展。

sentences.english: When you're out in the fresh air like this it makes you hungry.
sentences.chinese: 當你出外呼吸這麼新鮮的空氣時就很容易餓。

sentences.english: The equipment truck for the National Geographic special works on location.
sentences.chinese: 爲《國家地理》出外景的專用裝備卡車。

sentences.english: But they still enjoy a nice dinner out.
sentences.chinese: 但他們仍然喜歡出外就餐。

sentences.english: He went out to make a living when young, and has made a lot of achievements with great independence.
sentences.chinese: 他少年出外謀生，獨立支持，做了許多大事。

sentences.english: Eating out can be another money drainer if you don't know the places to go to.
sentences.chinese: 出外喫飯，可另排水錢，如果你不知道的地方去。

sentences.english: The mall has become the number one hang-out place for teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 這個購物中心已經成爲青少年出外遊逛的首選之地。

sentences.english: Sometimes he took her out to dinner, but always to cheap restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 有時他帶她出外喫晚飯，但去的都是些便宜的餐館。

sentences.english: New Yorkers tend to eat out or have takeaways more regularly than most Americans.
sentences.chinese: 紐約人比其他美國人更常出外就餐或食用外賣食品。

sentences.english: It's unsafe for girls to go out alone at night.
sentences.chinese: 女孩子晚上一個人出外是很危險的。

sentences.english: Not long afterwards, Gongsun and his followers went on a journey.
sentences.chinese: 沒過多久，公孫龍和他的門客一起出外遊玩。

sentences.english: Families that quarrel in the privacy of the home do well to dissemble when they go out to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 在家中爭吵的家庭出外晚餐時都掩飾得很好。

sentences.english: Not all the ants go out for the food.
sentences.chinese: 並非一切的螞蟻都出外尋食。

sentences.english: In feudal society, young girls were not allowed to go out freely.
sentences.chinese: 在封建社會時，年輕女孩不允許出外自由活動。

sentences.english: Some days later, Gongsun Long and his followers went on a trip.
sentences.chinese: 沒過多久，公孫龍和他的門客一起出外遊玩。

sentences.english: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.
sentences.chinese: 你從埃及挪出一棵葡萄樹，趕出外邦人，把這樹栽上。

definition: to go on a tour/to have an outing
family livelihood/a household's economic situation/family property
all over the place/everywhere and all directions
to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
to go on a scenic tour
to live one's life/to make a living
